author: Staff Reporter
text:
Residents of 100 villages around the waste processing unit in Kannalli-Seegehali coming under Bengaluru North taluk have threatened to launch an indefinite protest from Monday at Seegehalli Gate to block garbage-laden vehicles.

“Despite meeting Bangalore City Development Minister K.J. George, elected representatives and Bruhat Bengaluru Mahanagara Palike officials 15 days ago, we are not getting any relief from the foul smell and health hazards caused by the unit,” alleged Mr. Channappa, president of the Struggle Committee against Kannahalli, Seegehalli Garbage Processing Unit.

Residents of Kodigehalli, Soolikere, Channenahalli, Kadabagere, Machohalli, Kachohalli, Tavarekere and Chunchanakatte village panchayats are facing mosquito and fly menace, he alleged. “Even after several protests, 100 trucks dump garbage daily under police protection,” he alleged.

“If action is not taken immediately, we will launch a ‘Village garbage to City’ campaign. All residents will carry the garbage to Bengaluru and dump it outside the residences of the Chief Minister and Minister for Bangalore Development,” he said.

‘We are not getting any relief from the foul smell and health hazards caused by the unit’
title: Protest against garbage unit
